description: The watchtower sits atop a large group of stones set down in
brick-like patterns.  The view from this point of the city is nearly
perfect for the guards who patrol here.  They can see the forest to
the east, as well as the land surrounding it.  The ladder has been
tied to the top of the watchtower, allowing almost any Creeper to use
it when needed.  The watchtower is a circular room with no top,
allowing access to the night's sky after dark.  Torches have been
placed in a circular pattern across the room, as well.  In certain
areas of the room, a slab of stone will rise up above the usual
stones.  This is to allow a place of protection should enemies attack
the city.  Looking back over the city shows a somewhat
peaceful-looking town, although the being here are disgusting and
grotesque.  Homes rest in their set places and shops are placed
strategically to make for the easiest possible route.  The ladder
leads back down to under the watchtower.
18544.name: The Southeastern Watchtower

description: Many of the trees above have began to sway just a bit for some odd
reason.  Small strips of bark are located on the ground, some crunched
and ripped from those who have walked through this forest lately.  A
small group of bushes has begun to grow next to a large tree.  These
bushes look like a small group of kids in the middle of a grown up
forest of flourishing trees and brush.  The forest continues to the
east, west, and south.
18511.name: A Forest

description: The forest becomes much lighter than usual here, apparently due to
the large valley to the west.  The slope downwards begins just a
little to the west.  The density of the trees seems to thin out a lot
compared to the rest of the forest.  Small cracks of light have
apparently found their way to the ground during the day.  This is
noticable by the hardness of the soil in certain parts of the forest.
An assortment of rocks sits to one side of the forest, a bit scattered
by some sort of animal or person that has recently been this way.
18513.name: A Forest

description: This cave is an average size, and it really doesn't look that
special on the outside or inside.  There is the normal bench that can
be found in almost all of the homes of the Creepers.  A table sits in
front of the bench, and behind the both of them sits two cots.  Each
cot looks a bit old and used, and nothing really special.  There is
actually one thing that will surprise some.  There is a painting
hanging on the back wall of the cave.  It looks as if it could fall at
anytime, but it is something different from the rest of the caves.  It
is a painting of a pot of flowers, all them are brown and red.  The
flowers truly don't look like they are anything special as a result of
their bland color, but it does create something different that is
usually unseen in this town.  The street lies just to the south, with
the Jewelry & Clothing Store a bit more to the south.
18630.name: A Creeper's Home

description: A pretty bad smell rises out of this place.  This would be bad
enough, but it is made even worse when one discovers that this is
where all the Creepers come to buy their food and edibles.  Steam
rises up from various pots and pans that are littered around the cold,
hard ground.  Bits of old, rotten food has been thrown into a big pile
on a shelf, which barely clings to the side of the cave.  Insects and
bugs have found their way to this stack of food, each fighting for a
chance to bite into the rotten exterior of the food.  Opposite of the
loose shelf lies another shelf.  This one looks a bit more sturdy than
the other, but some strange instruments seem to be resting on top of
it.  These are apparently the tools used by Gorzo to create his food.
One could easily get these confused for instruments of torture and
pain.  Maybe these tools serve as both?
18533.name: Gorzo's Place

description: This part of the street has a very large cave to the south.  It
could be the biggest cave in this entire town.  Also, for those who
have ventured into this city before in the past, they will know that
the southern cave is the Creeper Inn.  It really isn't used by much
Creepers, but it shows the hospitality of the Creepers.  They have
allowed one entire cave to be used for outsiders and adventurers.
This isn't even found in some of the other, bigger cities, but it
really is a necessity for good, well-planned towns.  The street
continues to the east and west, with the northern wall blocking off
any exits in that particular direction.  It seems as though there is
an absence of any caves to the east, but the west has two caves on
each side of the street.
18557.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: The street running through the city in the Valley of the Creepers
is nearly coming to a halt, as there is only a bit more road to the
south before coming to the humongous wall that serves to block off the
Creepers from the outside world.  The sounds of business and various
activities can be heard from all directions, especially to the
northern part of this street.  An assortment of debris can be seen
left on the side of this street, out of the way of any people passing
by but still causing a mess in the process.
18536.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: The most noticeable thing about this section is the very small cave
to the east.  A very small piece of fabric hangs over the cave's
entrance, blowing in a soft wind from the inside of the cave.  The
dirt looks as if it has been here forever.  It has become grey and
hard over the past.  A couple small cracks can be found in the dirt,
showing just how old this town really is.  The tiny den to the east
looks quite difficult to enter for most of the normal-sized Creepers.
It is very obvious that some of the bigger Creepers have no way at all
of entering the cave.  Most outsiders would probably wonder what
exactly that cave is used for.  The only way to find out is to venture
into it.  If the cave doesn't sound appealing, one can continue to
venture throughout the town by going either north or south along the
street.
18573.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: Small plants and rock are much more common in this part of the
forest than the large, bulky trees that make up most of the woods.
Almost jungle-like, the shrubs and weeds that grow here are larger
than average.  A variety of colors is created from the many flowers
that grow up out of the ground.  These flowers can barely be seen due
to the much larger and heavier apperance of the grass and plants.
18512.name: A Forest

description: This path through the city seems very similar to the rest of the
city.  It is truly beginning to get repetitive now, and nothing really
looks new on the street, minus the caves that might be off of each
area.  There is an absence of any caves to the east or west, so there
is pretty much nothing of real interest here.  Instead of seeing a
large cave or really anything, the only visible things to the east are
the caves that sit far off in the distance, across the entire town
near the entrance.  This very street continues to the north and south,
with caves being visible in either of the two directions one might
choose to proceed with.
18572.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: The compact city lies just a bit more to the west.  The path
travelled here lies behind, a large cliff with a silent forest resting
atop it.  Buzzing sounds of business and bustling activity emanate
from the city, becoming larger with each step towards it.  What lies
inside the city still remains to be seen, as the entrance is
completely blocked by two humongous boulders on each side.  The
entrance to the west is nothing more than a hole in the middle of
these gigantic stones.  Looking closer, some sort of ooze can be
noticed slowly trickling from the top of each boulder to find its way
to the ground beside them.
18524.name: Approaching the City

description: The street outside can clearly be seen from inside this place.
Apparently, this serves as a home a group of Creepers in this city.
Although this is quite strange, those that live here have learned to
call it home over the last couple of years or so.  It is apparent that
this first 'room' in the cave served as a kitchen of some sort.  Pots
and pans have been left on a table that sits in the middle of the
cave.  The entire place is dirty and a pungent smell seems to float in
the air.  Another strange sight is the ladder which hangs from above.
It is somehow being held up from above, but what lies above is
completely unknown.  A small flap over the entrance makes a feeble
attempt to hide any sunlight from the outside during the day to the
south.
18538.name: A Creeper's Home

description: Two caves of average side sit on either side of the street.  There
doesn't really seem to be anything too exciting besides the two caves.
The ground is the same as it is through the entire city, and the
northern wall blocks off any view of the plains or plantlife that lies
to the north of the town.  The streets seem somewhat dead, aside from
the many Creepers who travel to and from their homes or stores.  No
plantlife or greenery is to be seen.  It is even a rumor that
plantlife ever existed in this town.  This adds to the strangeness of
the Creepers just a bit, but it doesn't mean they are evil.  Most of
the Creepers are actually peaceful and harmless, even though they are
horrid and ugly in appearance.  The street continues to the east and
west, with one cave to be found in either direction.
18558.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: The cave to the west has two large mounds of dirt on either side of
the entrance.  It sits opposite of the eastern wall, which is used for
protection.  The eastern wall is actually one huge wall which rises up
far above the ground.  The only places higher in this town are the
watchtowers, which sit in all four corners of the city.  This wall
does the job of blocking off the city from outsiders.  There is only
one entrance and one exit to the city, unless someone has created a
secret, hidden one that is unknown to the Creepers.  That is very
doubtful, though.  The street continues to the north and south.  The
northeastern watchtower gets closer to the north, while two caves lie
to the south.
18553.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: This part of the city branches off to form a street constructed of
various stones and rocks scattered in the ground.  Jagged edges of
rocks jut up from the ground at certain points, but the majority of
the ground is flat and safe.  Sounds of the creepers who live
throughout this town can be heard from all around, giving off an eerie
buzzing sound that seems to get louder each second.  The large
boulders that make up the outskirts of the city can be seen quite
easily from this point.  The north appears to be closer to the
entrance of the city, while a couple shops can be seen to the south.
18529.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: Two enormous masses of rock sit boldly on each side of the
entrance.  An awful smell seems to pour out of each one, but upon
further inspection it can be concluded that this terrible odor is
caused by some sort of gunk that dribbles from minute cracks and
crevices in the stones.  The entrance itself is nothing more than a
barely passable opening in the center of these blockages.  It is made
entirely of the same dirt that is found on the hill to the east.
Those who are brave enough and enjoy adventure will have little
trouble passing through here, even though it is a place of complete
mystery and bewilderment.
18525.name: Entrance to the City

description: This room is completely covered in a yellow mist it appears.  There
is a twirling whirlpool in the center of the room, with nice, warm
water for resting.  This particular room is quite different from the
types of rooms found in other Inns and hotels.  Instead of a bed, the
only thing used for resting is the large whirlpool.  There is a
crystal that emanates the yellow light near the back of the room, but
the light completely takes over the entire room.  This crystal's light
is obviously a magical gem that gives a soothing, healing aura to
whoever is resting or sleeping in it.  Other rooms lie to the west,
past the door.
18621.name: {yThe Yellow Room{x

description: The counter is similar to the counters of most human shops except
it is obviously made for shorter occupants.  After closely inspecting
the counter a small hidden compartment{x on the shopkeepers side is
uncovered.  ({Cexamine compartment{x)
Lots of traffic comes in from the west, where there is an
intersection between two roads.  This road meets the western street of
the city which goes from the northwestern area to the southwestern
area.  Just like most of the places along this road, there is a lot of
dirt that has been built up in the middle of the street.  This makes
the place look pretty messy.  The northern wall also has two large
piles of dirt that rest up against it.  There is a cave to the north
of here, right before the wall.  Nothing too special can be seen from
here, but maybe there is something interesting inside of the cave.
The street continues to the east, but meets up with another road to
the west to form an intersection of sorts.
18565.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: This dwelling serves to house a number of Creepers.  This is proved
by the eight cots to be found in this cave.  This is quite strange and
hard to imagine since this cave is not that big compared to some of
the others found here in the Creeper's city.  Perhaps not all of the
eight cots are used at once, and maybe some of them have just been
placed here for some odd reason.  There is also a large table that
takes up almost the entire cave, leaving only a bit of room to walk
around to get to the back of the dwelling.  This particular cave looks
extremely messy and trashy, too, as if no one has even attempted to
take care of it or clean it up in ages.  Clay pots and dishes have
been left all around, from the table to the hard, rocky floor the
table rests on.  Two sitting benches sit on either side of the table,
but they are also completely trashed with garbage and old food.  The
only escape from this mess is to the west, which leads back to the
street.
18639.name: A Creeper's Home

description: Large trees rise up from the ground on each side of the path,
blocking off exits to the north and south.  These trees seem to flourish
as they look completely healthy and fresh.  A little sapling appears
to have just began its growth in the center of the path.  A small
mound of soil has developed around it, giving the sapling the
appropriate nutrients to grow.  The sky above is blocked off by the
many branches and treetops that lie above.  The path continues east and
west, with a strange noise of rushing coming from the west.
18504.name: Dirt Path

description: The road running east and west through the Creepers' town continues
here, with little action going on as compared to the other areas of
the road.  This is probably a result of the complete lack of any
stores in this part of the road.  Instead, it looks as if it is only
used to connect one part of the street to the other.  It appears as
though it has done that job well, too, as the street looks completely
worn out from the travel that takes place every single day.  Aside
from the wall that stands to the south, nothing of real interest can
be located here.  The wall itself is used mainly for protection from
outside forces that would look to detroy the town.  A great deal of
the walkway is covered by the shadows of the southern wall, which
gaves a cooler place to walk when the daytime becomes too hot to
handle.  The street continues to the east and west, with two houses to
the east and a store to the west.
18577.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: The slope is very steep here as it approaches the very bottom of
the valley.  The hillside is constructed of the same monotonous bits
of rocks and dirt.  The dirt is a soft brown color that is spread out
in a very thin manner, as if it was done by someone on purpose.  Some
of the small animals that inhabit the forest above have left markings
that show their complete inability to walk down this steep part of the
hill, scratching and pawing to keep balance.  Broken twigs also serve
notice for this.  Back upwards, some of the larger trees in the forest
can be seen standing far above while the bottom of the valley is
extremely close.
18522.name: Hillside

description: Perhaps the most interesting part of this road is the view of the
northwestern watchtower which is just a bit to the north.  It stands
up very tall, overlooking the outside and inside of this tremendous
and unique town.  The western wall sits right here, too, but the tower
is just a bit higher than the wall.  This allows the guards who are on
duty to see completely everything going on within the city and on the
outside.  Back a bit in the distance to the south is the southwestern
watchtower.  It looks exactly the same as the northern one, just as
high and just as big.  There are two caves to the south, both of which
looks to be homes.  One looks as if it has been a bit trashed over the
many years of its existence, while the other looks nicely kept.  An
intersection sits a bit to the north, but there is one cave to be
found before reaching the intersection.
18568.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: The street closes in a bit more and creates an even more crowded
area in this part of the street.  The entrances to two stores rest on
the northern and southern sides of this path, soft blankets hanging
down over the entrances.  What exactly lies behind these blankets has
yet to be seen, and a bit of mystery is provided from the lack of
sight into the caves that stand there.  Looking farther down to the
west, one can see the southwestern watchtower.  This stands opposite
of the southeastern watchtower, which is just a bit to the east of
here.  Various wares that have been outdated have been dropped or
dumped around here.  These instruments have very little use it is
apparent.  The path begins to widen out to the east and west as the
street continues into the unknown.
18545.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: This part of the street is quite similar to the rest, old and worn
out.  There is nothing much more than dirt to be found on this part of
the trail.  One would probably wonder just how old this town really
is, since there is nothing new except for a few of the inventive ideas
created by some of the various shopkeepers throughout this town.
There are two caves on either side of this street, and the both of
them appear to be regular homes from the outside.  There is nothing
really important to the south, but there is another cave to the north.
This cave appears to be yet another home, but nothing else important.
The northeastern watchtower can be found even further to the north,
while the southeastern one is a bit in the distance to the south.
18552.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: The appearance of this cave is not what stands out the most about
it.  What stands out for the most part is the absolutely horrid and
fowl stench and odor that just runs throughout this cave.  The
terrible smell seems to suffocate those unsuspecting beings that
travel into this cave, clouding them in a thick haze of odor.  The
middle of the cave is definitely the worst, and it seems to thin out a
bit as one retreats further from the center.  But no place in this
cave is completely safe from the smell, as if a predator was lurking
around every shadow ready to pounce on their pray.  The source of the
smell remains unknown for the moment being, but perhaps the question
will be answered at one point.  The cave is very bare and there is
absolutely nothing of interest to be found.  No tables, cots, shelves,
tools - nothing!  Instead, a set of stairs have been formed out of the
very cave itself, making a way upwards into the unknown.  For those a
little nervous about exploring further, the road can be found back to
the south past the fabric hanging over the entrance.
18586.name: A Smelly Cave

description: This cave serves home to an unkown amount of Creepers.  Compared to
the Creeper's home on the opposite side of the street from this one,
this is a much bigger and better housing area.  Things are somewhat
neat, instead of the usual cluttered houses of the Creepers that
reside in this town.  The fabric hanging over the entrance has been
torn and ripped in places, so the light seems to float in freely from
the north, shining off of various instruments and tools that sit in
this house.  The walls of the cave have a rough appearance, but small
drops of water trinkle down and will eventually smoothe them out.  The
entrance to the cave is made of dirt, and has been damaged greatly
over the many years this home has been standing.  The dirt has almost
gave way to the solid rock that lies below.  Back north leads to the
city, and a street that runs easy and west.
18597.name: A Creeper's Home

description: This room is covered in a red aura that feels somewhat warm and
welcoming.  There is a medium-sized pool in the middle of the room,
which bubbles nonstop.  A crystal emanates a red aura lights up the
cave, bouncing around from one side to the other.  It is very close to
the pool, and it hits the pool at a straight, direct line.  This must
be how the Creepers rest and get healthy quickly.  This individual
room is very inexpensive.  Only the yellow room in the hotel is
cheaper.  One can't help but wonder if all four of the rooms have a
crystal and a pool.  The only way to find out would be to visit each
one individually, but that could cost a fortune.
18622.name: {rThe Red Room{x

description: This home sits across from another one on the opposite side of the
street.  This dwelling is of average size, yet it is quite unusual
compared to most of the other homes.  There is absolutely no fabric
hanging over the entrance, which almost all caves here have.  There
isn't a cot or anything to sleep on, either.  Instead, there is a very
old, faint crystal which barely shines at all anymore.  It is letting
off a faint, {Ggreen{x glow that can barely be seen.  Also, the table
doesn't have anything to sit on while eating.  This must mean the
Creeper here is very poor, or maybe he just chooses to be different.
The eastern street of the city lies just outside of this dwelling.
18627.name: A Creeper's Home

description: This house, although it has become the normal thing to see, is just
like the others.  There is absolutely nothing special or interesting
about this house.  The regular table sits in the middle of the room,
although this one is a bit misplaced and not truly centered.  A bench
for sitting sits beside the table, allowing Creepers to sit down and
eat their food.  The light from the outside shines down on pots that
sit on the table.  Some pots have also fallen down to break on the
tough, hard clay that makes up the ground.  A street lies to the west
of here.
18638.name: A Creeper's Home

description: This cave has many wooden pegs that stand up on their base, showing
off clothes that have been hung on them.  There is about a dozen or so
of these wooden pegs, and this creates a very wide array of clothing
choices.  These clothes aren't the average type of clothing, though,
and most outsiders to the town would find them quite strange upon
first look.  After a second look, they start to look decent and maybe
understandable, but they are still nothing to wear back in the bigger
towns and cities of the Realms.  There is also a glass clase which
holds some strange-looking jewelry.  Instead of the usual bright
colors that are used in most jewelry, there is brown and black jewels
that look very rusty and dirty.  Overall, this is the stereotypical
Creeper place - very unique and original, but somewhat strange and
eerie at the same time.  The exit lies to the north, where a soft
piece of fabric hangs over it, dirty and ragged.
18631.name: Creeper Clothes & Jewelry

description: Multitudes of dirt make up this part of the path.  Clay, dirt, mud,
and others make up this path.  Various colors also rest here,
including red, brown, and black.  Cracked mud rests on one side of the
path, obviously dried out from sitting in the sun all day.  Shadows
are created from some of the trees that stand tall above the path on
either side.  These shadows rest on the ground and make a soft portion
of dirt in certain parts.  The path also makes a swift
turn to the north here, while it stays straight to the east.
18505.name: Dirt Path

description: Soft spots of dirt have crumbled into millions of even smaller
pieces to give a sense of danger.  One must watch every step on the
way down.  Three mushrooms have found some way to live in this area.
The various colors of the mushrooms is something hard to find in this
bland, boring place of monotonous colors.  Purple spots on one
mushroom stand out very clearly compared to the background of the rest
of the hill.  The height and thickness of the grass has decreased
slightly, looking to start a pattern for the rest of the way down.
18520.name: Hillside

description: The main attraction on this division of the road is the strange
noises coming from the south.  It appears as if some sort of animals
that are making the noise.  A small hut stands before the southern
wall, with about three pins behind it.  The strange animal noises
float over from the pins, and curiosity definitely comes into play
here.  One can view the enormous city by glancing to the north, where
various caves have been constructed off in the distance.  These caves
are mostly brown or red in color, and most of them all appear to be
about the same size.  The road continues to the east and west, each
way covered up just a bit by the shadows created by the huge wall
standing tall to the south.  An assortment of broken stones can be
found sitting around on each side of this street, broken off by the
many years of repeated use.
18578.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: The walls that stand on the outside of the city rest just a bit to
the east.  The coloration of the ground is a bit faded and worn,
almost as if this is an ancient city after all.  Upon close inspection
of one particular stone, one can make out carved symbols and etchings
that must stand for something unknown to most.  Just a bit to the
south, the horizon is disturbed by the appearance of some sort of
watchtower at one corner of the city.  Various humming and buzzing
sounds can be heard coming from the east and west while the street
continues to the north and south.
18535.name: A North/South Street in the City

description: The ladder leads to a short hallway that has somehow been carefully
crafted out of the marble that makes up the cave's walls and ceiling.
Bits of water slowly drop at a repeated pace from above, falling
almost silently to the ground to form a slight puddle that oozes and
falls between even smaller cracks.  This short, dark hallway only
appears to extend a bit more to the west.  Some strange furniture sits
around this section of the hallway, constructed by a Creeper for a
Creeper.  The walls have also began to moisten as a result of the
dripping from the ceiling, but it is not exactly clear what the liquid
is.  Although it looks a bit normal, the texture seems more like slime
than regular water.  Swirls of colors can be seen in various spots on
the walls of the cave.  The ladder leads back down to the kitchen area
of the Creeper's home, while the hallway gets a bit darker to the
west.
18539.name: A Creeper's Home - Upstairs

description: This hallway is more like a tunnel in a cave.  The top of the
tunnel is nothing but dirt and rock.  Nothing really catches the
interest here, as it is only used as a way of travelling from the
front desk to the rooms in the inn.  The light from the north seems to
creep into this portion of the hallway, allowing those who lack the
ability to see in darkness to somehow make their way from one end of
the hallway to the other.  Bits of dirt have crumbled off of the sides
of the cave, falling down to form a pile of clay on the ground.  It
appears as though a staircase is to the south, constructed out of
nothing but clay and stone.  How exactly this was created remains
unknown, as it appears as though it could be completely naturally.
Back to the north lies the front office of the Creeper's Inn, where
one can go to purchase a room key or leave the inn.
18617.name: Hallway in the Creeper Inn

description: The southeastern corner of the Valley is home to the watchtower,
where Creepers are assigned to watch over the outside of the city.
This proves that the Creepers are actually intelligent beings instead
of blood-thirsty predators like most would believe.  The watchtower
lies directly above, and with the aid of a ladder it is reachable.
The watchtower has been constructed out of large slabs of marble and
stone.  Two lanterns sit on each side of the ladder, providing light
at night time.  The ladder itself is wooden, and a bit thicker that
normal ladders to provide support for the large race of Creepers who
reside in this town.  Above lies the part of the tower where guards
stand on patrol to overlook the outside of the city, and the city
itself lies back to the west, bustling with activity.
18543.name: Below the Southeastern Watchtower

description: The northwestern watchtower sits just above, a ladder hanging down
from the inside of the tower.  This is the place where guards stand on
watch to make sure no one is coming to harm the city.  The Creepers
will usually let groups of three people or less, but once large armies
start approaching, they are ordered to make note of it and report.
This particular part of the watchtower is made of stones and set up in
a circular way.  The tower above is also one big circle.  One can see
up above pretty clearly, so there is not much mystery or surprise on
the way.  There is an intersection to the east, where two different
roads meet and Creepers travel from one to another, too.
18583.name: Below the Northwestern Watchtower

description: This dwelling serves as a shop for the selling of crystals.  These
crystals are incredibly bright, and one has a difficult time looking
at them for too long.  There are four different colors of light all
shining at once.  {RRed{x, {Ggreen{x,{B blue{x, and{y yellow{x lights are all present
inside this cave, although they may be a little too bright to handle
for some.  There are many crystals sitting around the room, and that
really seems to be about the only things here.  There is a wooden
counter which comes up to the waist of the owner, who is standing
beside it.  The cave's exit is to the north, which leads to a street
that goes around the entire city.
18604.name: The Crystal Shop

description: The path running east and west along the southern end of the city
continues once again here.  One can actually hear the sounds of moans
coming from the east, probably coming from the slaves who are bought
and sold at the Pet Shop.  The southern wall takes a small dip in its
usually overwhelming size to look a little bit shorter than usual.
The bits of clay that surround the path and wall have really begun to
dry up due to the hot days that take place in the Creeper's village.
This has led to the formation of three or four large cracks in the
ground.  Although nothing dangerous, they still have a strange
appearance and it just adds to the overall weirdness of the Creepers
and their town.  The path continues to the east and west, with the Pet
Shop being found to the east, and a Creeper's home of some sort
visible to the west.
18579.name: An East/West Street in the City

description: This particular cave serves as a cave.  This comes to a huge
surprise to most people, as it is hard to imagine the Creepers
actually using currency.  This race is obviously a lot more advanced
than they appear to be.  The cave is actually cut in half by a large,
wooden wall.  There is a small opening in the middle of the wall,
offering a space for customers to come in and talk to the money
changer who is working.  Safety is taken very seriously here, and the
Creeper behind the counter will usually be cautious when changing
money with someone he or she doesn't know too well.  The cave's exit
is to the north, and one can find a street in that direction.
18551.name: The City Bank

description:
{xThe Creeper before you has devoted his life to the training of
young, adolescent Creepers.  He is very well built and looks to be a
bit older, but this doesn't stop him from being active in his life. 
He wears a tattered and torn shirt that matches his tattered and torn
pants.  He looks just like the other Creepers of the city - ugly and
horrid.
18500.room_name: A master {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, prepared to train even the youngest of students.
18500.name: a trainer {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

description:
{xJust a stupid wooden dummy, serving no true purpose except to get
hit on by the Creepers.
18501.room_name: A training dummy sits in the corner of the room.
18501.name: a training dummy~

description:
The banker really has nothing special to see.  It is just an
average Creeper behind the counter, awaiting your business.
18502.room_name: An average-sized {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands behind the counter, offering you help with your latest transaction.
18502.name: the banker~
18502.keywords: Creeper average-sized banker helper worker employee~
subroutines:
F res L
F vul I
F for AGX

description:
This Creeper resides here in the house, and is quite cautious of
intruders that are unknown.
18503.room_name: A middle-aged {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x is here, standing in the center of the house.
18503.name: a middle-aged {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

description:
This Creeper serves as the bartender here in the tavern.  He is a
bit husky compared to most other Creepers, but he looks to be in
decent shape.
18504.room_name: A bartender stands behind the counter, preparing a mixed drink for someone.
18504.name: the {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x bartender~
subroutines:
F res L
F vul I
F for AGXc

description:
A small, adolescent Creeper is here.  It looks very young and it
carries a random toy in its hand.
18505.room_name: A small, adolescent {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x is here, playing with the various toys in the cave.
18505.name: a small, adolescent {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

description:
This Creeper travels from one store to the other, buying and
selling various items and attempting to make a living.  There is
nothing special about this Creeper.  Tentacles sit on the top of the
head and the skin can only be described as pale.
18506.room_name: An adult {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, travelling from one shop to the other.
18506.name: a {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x resident~
subroutines:
F res L
F vul I

description:
A large Creeper is here, ready to sell his newest weapons.  This
Creeper is wearing some cheap-looking fabrics that really make him
look poor.  He does, however, have a pretty decent build which makes
him look quite strong.  He probably uses this strength while creating
the weapons for his Creeper people.
18507.room_name: A weaponsmith {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, waiting to sell his newly created weapons.
18507.name: a {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x weaponsmith~

description:
A Creeper resembling an ant with small wings scurries about.  When it rubs
its two wing-like projections together a field of static energy sparks
about the creature raising the hair on your body.
18508.room_name: A {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, standing guard atop this tower.
18508.name: a {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x guard~
subroutines:
F res L
F vul I
F for GXc

description:
This tall Creeper serves as the Jeweler and weaver of this town. 
He makes all of the strange clothes worn by the various Creeper who
reside here in the town.  He stands behind the counter and waits for
your business.
18509.room_name: A tall {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, studying {Mjewels{x and selling {Cclothes{x.
18509.name: the {MJeweler{x~

description:
This Creeper is of average height.  He acts as the owner of this
Pet Shop, and he also acts as a trader of the slaves who are
imprisoned here
18510.room_name: A decently sized {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, attempting to sell his pets to anyone who will purchase them.
18510.name: the {CPet Shop{x owner~
18510.keywords: Pet Shop owner store clerk Creeper large~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
The Queen of the Creepers is a very large, repulsive Creeper who is
about three or four times the size of average Creepers in this city. 
She has quite long arms and legs, and her skin seems to be melting all
the time.  Her skin seems to be bubbling and twitching nonstop,
creating a real disgusting sight.  She looks quite dangerous, and her
guards value her greatly, as does the entire race.
18511.room_name: A very large, repulsive Creeper is here waiting to spit out baby Creepers.
18511.name: the Queen {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

description:
The adult Creeper is quite large, even compared to some others in
this town.  His has large antennas that rest on the top of his head
and looks somewhat similar to a praying mantis.  His skin color is
that of green and blue together, and although he doesn't look to be
the smartest Creeper, he looks like he could do quite a bit of damage.
18512.room_name: A large adult {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, ready to protect his home at all costs.
18512.name: an adult {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

description:
Gorzo is a well-sized Creeper.  His body is very thick and slimy,
with molds and clumps of slime oozing off of him by the minute and
falling to the ground below.  Gorzo's face is incredibly ugly and
grotesque, with patches of hair breaking out and growing at random
spots.  He is a bit chubbier than most Creepers that populate the area
- it is his job to cook and sell food!
18513.room_name: A very {8secretive{x {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x rests in the shadows, looking to do some discreet business.
18513.name: a plump {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x named {8Gorzo{x~

18514.room_name: Ozlin the {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x is here, hiding in the shadows near the back of the cave.
18514.name: the {8secretive{x {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x, Ozlin~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This young Creeper is just a little girl.  There is not one
defining feature that makes her a female, it is just something about
her that lets you know.  Although she is but a child, she is still
dangerous and deadly....  And willing to fight, too!
18515.room_name: A small child {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, looking for her parents.
18515.name: a small, adolescent {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

18516.room_name: A thin and pale human child stands here, loyal to its master.
18516.name: a small human child~

description:
This Creeper is nothing special.  He has two small tentacles that
hang out of his head, and he also looks very disgusting.  He has very
pale skin, much like the other Creepers.  His eyes are very big and
oversized compared to most races in the Realms.  He is leaning over on
the counter, waiting to do business with whomever might walk in.
18517.room_name: A normal-looking {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x sits on the stool, leaning over on the counter and waiting to do business.
18517.name: the {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x Innkeeper~

18518.room_name: A guard to the Queen stands here, eyeing you with suspicion and caution.
18518.name: the Queen's Guardsmen~

description:
This kobold looks as if it has not been taken care of by either its
current or previous owner.
18519.room_name: A tiny{8 kobold{x stands here, looking as if it hasn't eaten in weeks.
18519.name: a pet{8 kobold{x~

description:
The satyr looks as if it hasn't been taken care of too well by its
current or previous owner.
18520.room_name: A rarely seen{Y satyr{x is here, stomping its hooves.
18520.name: a small{Y satyr{x~

description:
Tlorkin is a very short, skinny Creeper who looks to be in decent
shape.  He has a bit of muscles that show through his very rugged
clothing.  He makes a living working in this shop as a maker of tools.
18521.room_name: Tlorkin stands here, constructing a new tool for use by the {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{ys{x.
18521.name: the tool-maker, Tlorkin~

18522.room_name: A tall, skinny {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, brewing a potion of some sort.
18522.name: Wylke, the potion-brewer~

18523.room_name: A small child {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x is here, looking around the house.
18523.name: a young {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x child~

description:
This Creeper is of average size, and she would be considered very
beautiful by the other Creepers.  That is only for the Creepers,
though, as any other race would probably not find her attractive in
the least.
18524.room_name: The owner of the {CCrystal Shop{x is here, standing behind the counter.
18524.name: Slarza, the {CCrystal Shop owner~
18524.keywords: Slarza Crystal Shop owner standing Creeper~

18525.room_name: The father {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x stands here, looking over his children.
18525.name: a father {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

18526.room_name: A mother {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x is here, making an attempt to clean up the messy home.
18526.name: a female {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

18527.room_name: A baby {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x cries and cries, while crawling around on its knees.
18527.name: a crying baby {gC{yr{Ge{ye{gp{ye{Gr{x~

18599.name: test~

F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description: Desc Biggo's personal trainer is here...  Yep.
18550.name: the trainer~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
